compounddef.title: LARS: Light-Augmented Reality System for Collective Robotics Interaction 🚦🤖

sect1.title: ✨ What is LARS?
sect1.para: LARS (Light Augmented Reality System) is an open-source, cross-platform framework for experimentation, education, and outreach in collective robotics.

listitem.para: 🚨 Real-time Augmented Reality: Projects gradients, fields, trails, and robot states directly onto real-world robot arenas.
👀 Invisible → Visible: Makes collective dynamics tangible for researchers, students, and the public.
🔬 No Hardware Mods: Works with existing robots—no tags or changes needed!

entry.para: Dynamic overlays and projections, synchronized with real robots
Fast (38+ FPS), robust tracking for 100+ robots, no tags required
Free for research, teaching, and engagement

listitem.para: For Research: 🧪 Bridge the sim-to-real gap. Run reproducible, scalable, and dynamic experiments—preserving robot constraints.
For Education: 📚 Transform abstract swarms into interactive, hands-on learning. Perfect for classrooms.
For Outreach: 🌟 Demo swarm intelligence live—LARS brings robot collectives to life for everyone.

sect1.title: 👁️‍🗨️ Advanced Tracking & Visual Augmentation
sect1.para: LARS uses a powerful, real-time tracker based on ARK (Automatic Robot Kinematics) but goes much further:

listitem.para: ⚡ Tracks 100+ robots in real time
🔎 Robust to occlusions, lighting, and noise
🔵 Generalizes to any “circular” robot (Kilobot, Thymio, E-puck, more)
🏷️ No tags or hardware mods!
🧠 Auto-preserves & recovers identities—even during close encounters

sect1.para: Beyond tracking: LARS uniquely projects **virtual visual objects**—gradients, cues, interactive signals—onto the arena and atop robots.

listitem.para: 🌀 Simulate virtual environments and signals without hardware changes
🛰️ Provide dynamic, spatial feedback to robots and collectives
🕹️ Explore new human-swarm and robot-environment interaction

sect1.title: 🏗️ Architecture Overview
sect1.para: LARS is built on the classic Model-View-Controller (MVC) pattern:

listitem.para: 🧩 Model: World state, physics, and objects
🖼️ View: GUI, visualization, and projector output
🎮 Controller: Experiment orchestration, tracking, and logic

sect1.title: 🧑‍🔬 Example Scenarios

listitem.para: 🗳️ Collective Decision-Making: Track & visualize 100+ Kilobots in a noisy, projected environment
⏰ Swarm Synchronization: Record robot states and group dynamics in real time
🕹️ Interactive Demos: Let visitors steer/interact with swarms and see collective behavior
🧑‍🏫 Educational Labs: Manipulate real experiments to teach robotics, physics, and complexity
